conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine motion direction.
From 0 to 1 second: The velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
From 1 to 2 seconds: The velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
From 2 to 3 seconds: The velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s.
Positive velocity indicates motion in the positive direction. Negative velocity indicates motion in the negative direction.
At 2 seconds, the velocity is 0 m/s.
At 3 seconds, the velocity is -2 m/s.
Since the velocity is negative from 2 to 3 seconds, the particle is moving in the negative direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
